item.title: Report E-2024050469
item.description:
Report E-2024050469

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 15, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was damaged in transit and released approximately one-quarter (0.25) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized simple green and absorbents to clean the area and containerized all waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.title: Report I-2024010013
item.description:
Report I-2024010013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T00:37:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: Coopersburg
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PENN TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver failed to properly secure a delivery fitting to the UST coupler. During delivery, the fitting dislodged from the coupler allowing release of approx 50 gallons of Fuel Oil affecting the concrete delivery pad and the surrounding asphalt parking lot and a portion of asphalt alley, as well as a 15' x 6" area of grass and dirt. Loose product was contained with spill response materials and booms to prevent spread or storm drain intrusion. Affected areas were treated with oil absorbents that were drummed and removed from the site for disposal by Hepaco.

item.title: Report E-2024050369
item.description:
Report E-2024050369

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-22T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-08
  • City: YORK
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was moving containers at the 10 day in-transit storage area with a forklift. The employee needed to move the 951H2 overpack container but due to the issues with utilizing certain drum carts to move these, the employee chose to widen the forks and lift the drum utilizing the edges on the container. Upon lifting with the forks, the container slipped from the forks landing on its side. The employee quickly righted the container with the forklift and tightened the closure, but an estimated 1/2 gallon had leaked out. The 95 gallon overpack contained one 55 gallon drum inside.
